Part - III: (Defect Details)
a) Defect Category: Observation
b) Defect Observed: Pneumatic starter motor overheat. Anomaly detected during routine inspection.
Part IV: Investigation: (Details of Examination including previous similar Defects)
a) Root Cause Analysis: Software algorithm error in control logic implementation
b) Findings / Conclusions: Detailed investigation conducted on the defective Pressurization component. Physical
examination revealed signs of wear and degradation.
c) Remedial Measures Conduct non-destructive testing to verify structural integrity
i. Corrective Action:
ii. Preventive Action: Introduce protective coating to prevent environmental degradation
d) Attributable Code: M - Other Reasons
Remarks: Complete defect analysis performed. Lessons learned documented.
Part V: Remarks by Design
Design assessment confirms component operated within specified limits. Recommend enhanced inspection protocol.
Date: 18/05/2023 Authorized Signatory of Design: Sqn Ldr A.R. Desai
